doc.after: As with other welding processes such as gas metal arc welding shielding gases are necessary in GTAW to protect the welding area from atmospheric gases such as nitrogen and oxygen which can cause fusion defects porosity and weld metal embrittlement if they come in contact with the electrode the arc or the welding metal The gas also transfers heat from the tungsten electrode to the metal and it helps start and maintain a stable arc
